USA: President Warren G. Harding died of a heart attack at the Palace Hotel in San Francisco.
Vice President Calvin Coolidge was sworn in as President, the day following the death of President Harding.
Teapot Dome scandal: Secretary of the Interior Albert B. Fall resigned as a result of the scandal.
The Equal Rights Amendment, written by women's suffragist leader Alice Paul, was first introduced in the Senate.
Slovenia: Prefect of Julian March interdicts Slovene and Croatian language at the administration.
Philippine: Santiago Ronquillo, a.k.a. Tiagong Akyat, was killed by a force consisting of Manila Chief of Police John Fulton Green and the Philippine constabulary, in Noveleta, Cavite.
Nepal: Treaty with Britain affirms Nepal's sovereignty.
Ireland: Irish Civil War: IRA Chief of Staff Frank Aiken orders volunteers to dump arms - effectively ending the Civil War.
Germany: Occupation of the Ruhr: France invaded the valley of the Ruhr.
Gustav Stresemann of the national liberal German People's Party was appointed chancellor and minister for foreign affairs.

Beer Hall Putsch: Nazi Party chairman Adolf Hitler led some six hundred Sturmabteilung (SA) to the Bürgerbräukeller in Munich, where they held Bavarian state officials Gustav Ritter von Kahr, Hans Ritter von Seisser and Otto von Lossow at gunpoint to demand they support a Nazi coup.
France: Beginning of Franco-Belgian occupation of the Ruhr.
China: The Radio Corporation of China was founded.
The KMT and CPC agreed to the First United Front, under which Communists would join the KMT as individuals to help combat warlordism.
Brazil: The Brazilian Society of Chemistry is founded.
Brazil's first radio broadcasting station, the Radio Society of Rio de Janeiro, is founded; it is still working under the name Rádio MEC.
Belgium: Sabena is founded at Brussels Airport
Australia: Stanley Bruce became 8th Prime Minister of Australia.
Construction begins on the Sydney Harbour Bridge.
Armenia: Establishment of the Soviet Union; Armenian SSR joins the Soviet Union.
Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast is created granting Armenian autonomy for Nagorno-Karabakh within Azerbaijan SSR.
Albania: The Sunnis of Albania broke the last of their ties with the dissolving Ottoman Empire, pledging primary allegiance to their native country.
